channel.title: My First 2D Game Development [CLOSED]
channel.description:
[size=24pt][font=arial black]THIS PROJECT IS OFFICIALLY CLOSED, I HAVE BEGUN MAKING A STEALTH GAME IN UNITY[/font][/size]
Hola señor(a), recently, I have been working on a 2D Medieval (not medieval fantasy) game from SCRATCH meaning no engine or whatever.
Here is a list of what I've done:
Terrain Easy Terrain Making/Editing Player Moves to where you click like RuneScape Strings displaying Health and Level on screen Ability to change movement speed GameObject Managing Scrolling Camera Animated walking Object collision
In Progress:
Right Click Drop Down Menu with Options
Not Done (Todo list):
Object Interaction Items Equipment GUI (inventory, etc) Combat NPC's
A picture of current progress:
[IMG width=1000]http://i44.tinypic.com/a0yqfk.png[/img]
NEW PROGRESS (19.1.14)
[u][b]Animation changes depending on click location[/b][/u] ADDED DIAGONAL MOVEMENT SPRITES
[IMG width=1000]http://i40.tinypic.com/2qmerud.png[/img]
A picture of walking in progress: [IMG width=1000]http://i43.tinypic.com/16k8bk3.png[/img]
Solid Camera scrolling:
[IMG width=1000]http://i44.tinypic.com/162a893.png[/img]

item.title: My First 2D Game Development [CLOSED]
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Thread Updated: More pics added like requested

Things achieved: Perfect scrolling, walking, and animation

EDIT: New update: Object collision 90% (corners have a bit of an issue and some minor bugs but other wise fine)

Also working on right click drop down menu with options.

Read full topic

should never really have a field being checked there… There isn’t a reason you would have for using a field over a method as the conditional[/quote]

item.title: My First 2D Game Development [CLOSED]
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

x1 att ftw x:

then get one…

Lemme just post it here:

[code=java] public void updatePosition() {
double distx = 0, disty = 0;
distx = mouseX - playerX;
disty = mouseY - playerY;
if (distx != 0.0 || disty != 0.0) {
System.out.println("DistX: “+distx+” DistY: "+disty);
}
double distance = Math.hypot(distx,disty);
if (!hitWall) {
if (distance > speedOfMovement) {
movementX += speedOfMovementdistx/distance;
movementY += speedOfMovementdisty/distance;
playerX += speedOfMovementdistx/distance;
playerY += speedOfMovementdisty/distance;
repaint();
} else {
repaint();
}
} else if (hitWall) {

	}
}[/code]

Where:

int mouseX = The x coordinate of the player's click int mouseY = The y coordinate of the player's click double playerX = 800 (because the player is fixed at 800,450 on the screen.) double playerY = 450 (because the player is fixed at 800,450 on the screen.) double speedOfMovement = 5.0

The issue: Works fine until you reach the 1000+ x and y coordinate range and below 300 x and y coordinate range for some reason. Once it stops working fine, basically the player just acts stupid and doesn’t seen to want to move past the area.

Read full topic

item.title: My First 2D Game Development [CLOSED]
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“naseem142, post:2, topic:538447”]So many projects lately , i hope that you are serious about this without leaving it halfway through.

Good luck[/quote]

Well this is my first game and I really enjoy the concept of making one on my own cuz with RSPS’s there is so many more advanced things that you need to do like dealing with the cache, and the fact that it’s multiplayer. This probably won’t be abandoned.

[size=24pt][font=arial black]THIS PROJECT IS OFFICIALLY CLOSED, I HAVE BEGUN MAKING A STEALTH GAME IN UNITY[/font][/size]

Hola señor(a), recently, I have been working on a 2D Medieval (not medieval fantasy) game from SCRATCH meaning no engine or whatever.

Here is a list of what I’ve done:

Terrain
Easy Terrain Making/Editing
Player Moves to where you click like RuneScape
